titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert B. Fetter Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Jay Garcia

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:49

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, and itineraries which document the professional activities of Robert B. Fetter, especially throughout the 1980s. Many of the materials relate to Fetter's expertise in the field of health care management, and particularly to his innovations and work concerning Diagnosis Related Groups (DRGs). The papers include some files pertaining to Fetter's responsibilities within the Yale University School of Organization and Management.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This materials are mainly open for research, with some exceptions. Series I, boxes 1-2, is closed until 2009. Series III, box 8, is closed until 2007. Materials contained in Series V, box 10 is restricted until January 1, 2063 as established by Yale Corporation regulations.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert Barclay Fetter Papers (MS 1496). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, and itineraries which document the professional activities of Robert B. Fetter, especially throughout the 1980s. Many of the materials relate to Fetter's expertise in the field of health care management, and particularly to his innovations and work concerning Diagnosis Related Groups (DRGs). The papers include some files pertaining to Fetter's responsibilities within the Yale University School of Organization and Management. Forms part of the Contemporary Medical Care and Health Policy Collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert Barclay Fetter was born in Berwyn, Illinois, in 1924. In 1947, he was awarded a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Virginia Polytechnic Institute. Afterward, he went on to receive both an M.B.A. and a D.B.A. from Indiana University, in 1949 and 1952, respectively. From 1953 to 1958 Fetter worked as an assistant professor of industrial management at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. In 1958, Fetter arrived at Yale University as an associate professor of industrial management, the first of a series of faculty and administrative posts he would assume at the university, including the Harold J. Hines, Jr. professorship in health care management and the chairmanship of the Yale University School of Organization and Management.

The professional accomplishment for which Fetter is most widely known is the development of Diagnosis Related Groups (DRGs), a conceptual framework which helps to define the "products" of a hospital. The DRG system identifies these products based on the characteristics of patients receiving comparable services. For Fetter, DRGs held the possibility of improving cost accounting, budgeting, and quality controls in hospitals. The application of DRGs in the United States, including their use as the basis of Medicare claims, led to international demand for more knowledge about their possibilities for hospitals in other parts of the world. Fetter's expertise in the development of DRGs regularly took him to meetings and conferences in different countries.
Fetter retired from the faculty at Yale in 1989.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in four series: I. Correspondence, 1982-1989. II. Conferences and Workshops, 1978-1989. III. Yale University School of Organization and Management (SOM) Files, 1983-1986. IV. General Files, 1981-1989.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence is organized chronologically and documents the Yale School of Organization and Management, Fetter's travel plans, meetings, reports, publications and some personal finance. Both directly and indirectly, much of the correspondence concerns Fetter's research on Diagnosis Related Groups (DRGs). There is some correspondence between Fetter and researchers and faculty at other institutions about his work. In addition, there are evaluations and comments by Fetter regarding articles written by others and submitted to journals for possible publication. Some of the letters also describe Fetter's association with the Henry J. Kaiser Foundation, as well as the Health Systems Management Group that existed for a time within the Yale School of Organization and Management.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The conference and workshop files are arranged alphabetically by the institution primarily responsible for the meeting. They mostly contain materials relating to formal discussions and presentations on Diagnosis Related Groups (DRGs) and other aspects of hospital management. The files include Fetter's notes, outlines, and presentation materials. Pamphlets and brochures from the institutions themselves are often included as well.

Yale University School of Organization and Management Files

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by topic, most of these files relate to Fetter's work as a faculty member of the Yale University School of Organization and Management (SOM). The folder on Fetter's leave of absence documents some of his professional activities abroad. The files refer to SOM more in general terms than they do to Fetter's involvement in the school. The files are restricted until 2007.

did.unittitle: Program in Hospital Administration, Diagnosis Related Groups (DRGs) Conference
Yale University Hospital Administration Alumni Association (YUHAAA)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: General Files document some of Robert Fetter's professional activities other than formal conferences and workshops. The first folder, "Biographical," holds a curriculum vita which lists all of Fetter's major publications, from 1951 to 1988. The "Interviews" folders do not hold transcripts of Fetter's television appearances, but the "Your Practice" folder contains a working script and set of questions for the program that featured Fetter.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials contained in this box is restricted until January 1, 2063 as established by Yale Corporation regulations.
